sen.j: 大行天皇（たいこうてんのう）は、天皇が崩御（死去の意）した後、追号が贈られるまでの呼称。
sen.e: Taiko-Tenno is a naming of Emperor; it is applied after the demise of the Emperor until a posthumous title is conferred.
Taiko-Tenno is an appellation of emperor, which is applied during a period from the demise of the Emperor to the grant of Tsuigo (posthumous title).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Taiko-Tenno is an appellation of emperor, which is applied during a period from the demise of the Emperor to the grant of Tsuigo (posthumous title).

sen.j: 大行は「大いなる行ない」を意味し、ここでは死去した天皇への顕彰を表す語として用いられている。
sen.e: Taiko means 'great behavior'; here, the word is used with the meaning of honor to the demised Emperor.
Taiko means 'great behavior,' where the word is used to pay honor to the demised Emperor.
Taiko means 'great behavior,' where the word is used to pay honor to the demised Emperor.

sen.j: また、「逝きて帰らぬ天皇」の意味があるともいわれている。
sen.e: Also, it is said to have a meaning of 'the Emperor who passed away and never returns'.
Also, it is said to have a meaning of 'the Emperor who passed away and never returns'.

sen.j: 現在の制度（一世一元の制）に基づけば、在位中の元号をもって追号とされることが定制である。
sen.e: According a current system isse ichigen no sei (system of one era per Emperor), Gengo (an era name) during the Emperor's reign usually becomes a posthumous title.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to a current system (which is known as 'Isse ichigen no sei' [literally, the practice of assigning one era name to one emperor]), Gengo (an era name) during the Emperor's reign usually becomes that Emperor's posthumous title.
sen.cmt: 脱字・形式を修正しました
sen.e: According to a current system (which is known as 'Isse ichigen no sei' [literally, the practice of assigning one era name to one emperor]), Gengo (an era name) during the Emperor's reign usually becomes that Emperor's posthumous title.

sen.j: しかし、あくまでも追号が贈られるのは大喪の礼に先立って行われる追号奉号の儀を執り行ってからである。
sen.e: However, it should be noted that a posthumous title is conferred after the ceremony for dedicating a posthumous title that precedes the Rites of an Imperial Funeral.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it should be noted that a posthumous title is conferred during the Tsuigo hogo no gi (a ceremony for dedicating that title) which precedes the Taiso no rei (funeral service of a Japanese emperor).
sen.cmt: 表現の修正・補足を加えました
sen.e: However, it should be noted that a posthumous title is conferred during the Tsuigo hogo no gi (a ceremony for dedicating that title) which precedes the Taiso no rei (funeral service of a Japanese emperor).

sen.j: その為、『大行天皇』の名称は、追号奉号の儀以前の段階に於いて、崩御された前天皇の名を官報に掲載する場合でも用いられるものである。
sen.e: Therefore, the naming ''Taiko-Tenno'' is used even in a case where the demised former Emperor's name appears on official gazettes before the dedication ceremony of a posthumous title.
Therefore, the appellation ''Taiko-Tenno'' is used to refer to the demised emperor on official gazettes before the dedication of his posthumous title in the ceremony.

sen.j: 各宗教団体の機関紙などでは「大行天皇の追悼法要営まれる」などと掲載されている。
sen.e: For example, such a sentence as 'a Buddhist memorial service for Taiko-Tenno was held' appears in religious organizations' journals.
In fact, a sentence like 'A Buddhist memorial service for the Taiko-Tenno is held' appears in journals published by several religious organizations.
sen.cmt: 表現・形式を修正しました
sen.e: In fact, a sentence like 'A Buddhist memorial service for the Taiko-Tenno is held' appears in journals published by several religious organizations.

sen.j: 例えば、仏教教団において位牌をたてる場合などには、追号が贈られるまでは白木や紙で仮の位牌を立てたりして法要を営む場合もある。
sen.e: In Buddhist organizations, memorial service is sometimes held preparing temporal ihai (ancestral tablets) made of plain wood or paper until a posthumous title is conferred, if ihai is necessary.

For instance, in the case where a Buddhist organization provides memorial service for the demised emperor before his posthumous title is conferred, they often use a temporary ihai (Buddhist mortuary tablet) made of plain wood or paper wherever necessary.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
